words.defineEn: a rustic forest god or spirit that is part human and part goat
words.defineVi: một vị thần rừng mộc mạc hoặc linh hồn là một phần của con người và một phần của dê

examples: And as the world’s climate changed, so did its flora and fauna.
Fossils of marine fauna like crinoids are common from this time.
As fauna and flora flourish, Earth’s climate slowly recovers from millennia of human impact.
The other fauna at Luoping may have also played a part in pushing Atopodentatus toward herbivory.
First came the mysterious Ediacaran fauna, and then the animals that mark the Cambrian Explosion.
words.defineEn: a living organism characterized by voluntary movement
words.defineVi: một sinh vật sống đặc trưng bởi phong trào tự nguyện

examples: Yeah, I'm feeling very lethargic.
I'm feeling rundown, I feel lethargic.
If we're feeling really lethargic, we should probably give our body a rest.
A human-sized ant, very lethargic, very crumpled, can’t do yoga.
Seven, feeling fatigued or lethargic.
words.defineEn: deficient in alertness or activity
words.defineVi: thiếu tỉnh táo hoặc hoạt động

examples: The truth of it is that postpartum depression doesn't always present itself as sadness, lethargy, crying.
Parvo causes lethargy, fever, vomiting, diarrhea and loss of appetite, which leads to dehydration, damage to the intestines and immune system, and even death.
These include depressive disorders, typified by prolonged hopelessness and lethargy, and bipolar disorders, the most prominent of which involve alternating between depression and mania.
words.defineEn: a state of comatose torpor (as found in sleeping sickness)
words.defineVi: trạng thái mê man hôn mê (như được tìm thấy trong bệnh ngủ)

examples: But for a campaign to take out against my daughter Bridget McCain was just unconscionable.
But in California, there can be this huge disparity, which I think is kind of an undue and in my opinion, unconscionable, burden placed on younger people and newcomers.
No. 1, because Bloomberg is going to spend an unconscionable amount of money no matter who the nominee is on the Dems.
words.defineEn: excessively unreasonable or unfair and therefore unacceptable
words.defineVi: quá vô lý hoặc không công bằng và do đó không thể chấp nhận được

examples: The concept of Freudian slips came from Freud’s research on the subconscious mind.
"They can have kind of almost direct access to your subconscious."
Our brains make trillions of little subconscious decisions like this every day, but usually all humans make pretty much the same ones.
This happens when exposure to a stimulus influences a person’s behavior, often on a subconscious level.
They still got a sense for the words on a subconscious level, but didn’t read them exactly.
words.defineEn: the part of the mind that is not currently in focused awareness, but still influences thoughts, feelings, and behavior, often through automatic or involuntary processes
words.defineVi: một phần của tâm trí hiện không tập trung vào nhận thức, nhưng vẫn ảnh hưởng đến suy nghĩ, cảm xúc và hành vi, thường thông qua các quá trình tự động hoặc không tự nguyện

words.defineEn: the peers of a kingdom considered as a group
words.defineVi: các đồng nghiệp của một vương quốc được coi là một nhóm

words.defineEn: eminent beyond or above comparison
words.defineVi: vượt trội hơn hoặc trên so sánh

examples: Still, our antagonism hasn’t stopped the snakes from moving into big cities.

Despite some advancements in the Civil Rights Movement, this combination of disconnect and antagonism grew through the 1970s as the benefits of public employee unionization offered new rights for police departments.
words.defineEn: (biochemistry) interference in or inhibition of the physiological action of a chemical substance by another having a similar structure
words.defineVi: (hóa sinh) can thiệp hoặc ức chế hoạt động sinh lý của một chất hóa học bởi một chất khác có cấu trúc tương tự

examples: Prejudice is a poison that divides and conquers the people that are engaged in this fear based, antagonistic way of living.
Wow, I don't usually get that antagonistic in our videos.
And they should frequently show so-called antagonistic or disinhibited personality traits, which include things like manipulation, hostility, risk-taking, and impulsivity.
Hundreds of videos reviewed by The Times show that although protesters were antagonistic, officers often responded with disproportionate force.
But it showed how crazy things really were, and how antagonistic people were toward them.
words.defineEn: characterized by antagonism or antipathy
words.defineVi: đặc trưng bởi sự đối kháng hoặc ác cảm

examples: Hume said it’s fallacious to assume that just because something is a certain way, that means that it ought to be that way.
words.defineEn: intended to deceive
words.defineVi: nhằm mục đích lừa dối

examples: That’s just a fallacy.
That's the common belief fallacy.
If so, you have fallen victim to the SUNK COST FALLACY.
The key is something called the base rate fallacy.
When we insist that random events have meaning, you've fallen victim to the Texas sharpshooter fallacy.
words.defineEn: a misconception resulting from incorrect reasoning
words.defineVi: một quan niệm sai lầm do lý luận không chính xác

examples: I'm so fallible.
These are all fallible technologies.
So, yes, human vision is fallible, but those mistakes that it makes can help us understand that wonderfully complex system.
Although they’re meant to demonstrate longevity, more often than not the symbols of power are just as fallible as the humans who create them.
But also, contrary to the (always fallible) theory that bombing breaks civilian resolve, the British public refused to give in.
words.defineEn: likely to fail or make errors
words.defineVi: có khả năng thất bại hoặc mắc lỗi

examples: The Maya’s advanced writing system names individuals using strings of syllabic glyphs.
words.defineEn: consisting of a syllable or syllables
words.defineVi: bao gồm một âm tiết hoặc nhiều âm tiết

words.defineEn: forming or dividing words into syllables
words.defineVi: hình thành hoặc chia từ thành âm tiết

words.defineEn: a verse line having ten syllables
words.defineVi: một dòng thơ có mười âm tiết

words.defineEn: a word having two syllables
words.defineVi: một từ có hai âm tiết

words.defineEn: physical weakness or infirmity that is caused by a disease, illness, or aging
words.defineVi: suy nhược cơ thể hoặc ốm yếu do bệnh tật, bệnh tật hoặc lão hóa

examples: Because it's really debilitating.
It's overwhelmingly debilitating.
President-elect Biden said the efforts were debilitating to the country.
It's debilitating, it's distracting
For Greg Rosen, months of debilitating symptoms without a clear diagnosis, prognosis, or even an idea of what lasting damage there is has been traumatizing.
words.defineEn: make weak
words.defineVi: làm yếu đi

words.defineEn: causing debilitation
words.defineVi: gây suy nhược
